perturbation.original_text: Each driver will have a set amount of time (e.g. 10 seconds) to accept or reject the order, or the order will automatically be rejected by time and the lack of response will be recorded for future reference/internal driver ranking in the future.
perturbation.changed_text: Each driver will have a set amount of time (e.g. 2 seconds) to accept or reject the order, or the order will automatically be rejected by time and the lack of response will be recorded for future reference/internal driver ranking in the future.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the driver's acceptance time to 2 seconds creates an unreasonable timeframe, potentially violating labor laws related to fair working conditions and opportunity. This may violate laws regarding reasonable opportunity for drivers to assess and accept delivery requests.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Unreasonable working conditions standards; potentially violates minimum wage laws if drivers are not given reasonable time to accept requests and therefore earn less.
